title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.3: COUNTY WATER DEPARTMENT CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Output 1.3: County water departments have increased resources and improved skills to provide and monitor sustainable and safe drinking water to the most vulnerable and marginalized communities, which contributes to Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1 - Reduced Mortality & Stunting: Increased proportions of vulnerable children, pregnant and lactating women, including adolescent girls, have equitable access to and use quality Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), Nutrition, Health and HIV/AIDS services to reduce their risk of mortality, preventable diseases, stunting and other forms of malnutrition, and improve their birth outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3: County water departments have increased resources and improved skills to provide and monitor sustainable and safe drinking water to the most vulnerable and marginalized communities

description.narrative: High level advocacy with County leadership on enhanced sustainability framework for rural water schemes contributed to raising the profile of sustainability agenda in county sector forums. With UNICEF's support, three counties developed a water climate risk resilience framework to make planning and implementation process more risk-informed. UNICEF continued to support innovations for improving access to safe water supply for rural populations through solarization of boreholes and installation of water ATMs which enhance sustainable operation for increased revenue generation and accountability. UNICEF also launched a large rural water supply project in one of the most drought-prone ASAL counties in Kenya. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of counties implementing independent sustainability checks with a clear feedback mechanism
Proportion of people accessing basic drinking water during the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support.
